The denial of the right in question does not imply the denial of duty on the part either of individuale or of communities towards those who are in want. Duty and right are not always and in all respecto co-extensive. The individual isin duty bound to ba not only just but generous and charitable towards his fellow-man; but they have no rights on his generosity and charity, as they have on his justice. The only right which a man has that is ‹zo-extensive with his duty is that of being unhindered in the discharge of his duty. As regards his rights in relation to others his duty may very often be not to assert or exercise them.
